paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Proband P4 was diagnosed with early-onset bilateral breast cancer (44 y) and had a family history of glioma (49 y) and gastric cancer (49 y) in maternal second-degree relatives.

functional_data.summary: The variant leads to a 13-base pair deletion at the start of BRCA2 exon 15, causing a frameshift and a premature stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is present in a patient with a significant family history of breast cancer.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional analysis and family history.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first study to provide functional analysis confirming the pathogenicity of this variant.
key_quotes: Sequencing results revealed a 13-base pair deletion at the start of BRCA2 exon 15, leading to a frameshift that transformed the amino acid sequence at position p.(Asp2478Val) and introduced a premature stop codon.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the BRCA2 variant was successfully extracted.
